com.informatica.mdm.userexit

Interface PostLoadUserExit


  • public interface PostLoadUserExit
    The PostLoad user exit is used in both the load job and the Put SIF api. For the batch load, this is called at the end of processing for each block, After sending changes to the DB and before commit. In case of the Put API, its called at the end of processing for that record. Any failure encountered in the user exit will result in that block being rejected in the batch load. The data is committed after all records in the block have been processed.
    See Also:
    UserExitContext

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void processUserExit(UserExitContext userExitContext, ActionType actionType, Map<String,Object> baseObjectDataMap, Map<String,Object> xrefDataMap, List<Map<String,Object>> xrefDataMapList)
      Entry point from the hub to the custom user exit code.

    • Method Detail

      • processUserExit

        void processUserExit(UserExitContext userExitContext,
                     ActionType actionType,
                     Map<String,Object> baseObjectDataMap,
                     Map<String,Object> xrefDataMap,
                     List<Map<String,Object>> xrefDataMapList)
              throws Exception
        Entry point from the hub to the custom user exit code. This method is called for each record in a block of the load job.
        Parameters:
        userExitContext - User exit context that is passed from the hub
        actionType - Indicates whether the record is inserted or updated
        baseObjectDataMap - A map containing the column names and column values of the base object record
        xrefDataMap - A map containing the column names and column values of the corresponding cross reference record
        xrefDataMapList - A map containing the column names and column values of all affected cross reference records
        Throws:
        Exception
